name: Cmd Linux
body:
### Welcome to the LinuxCMD homepage!
This website is for the LinuxCMD game, created by and for the United States Naval Academy, but available here for free.

### What is it?
LinuxCMD is a game written in Java to give people a thorough understanding of how a Linux command-line works and how useful it can be, along with teaching 29 different commands, as well as several concepts such as pipes, command history etc.

### Sounds good, where do I get it?
LinuxCMD is available straight from this site, as well as being available [at the github repos.](https://github.com/Roguebantha/CMDLinux)


### Who made this thing again?
This game was created solely by Seth Jenkins (@Roguebantha), but was advised by at the time of writing Lieutenant-Commander-Select Dane Brown at the United States Naval Academy. 

### How can I contact you?
I, Seth Jenkins, am available at [starwarsfreak000@gmail.com](mailto:starwarsfreak000@gmail.com). Feel free to send me an email if you have any questions, bugs, thank-you's, etc. After the summer of 2013, this game is not going to be actively supported, but I may be able to solve bugs anyway. I also love to hear that I was able to help someone out, so if I helped you, I'd  love to hear so!
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
